text.0: thou of a trutho prthivi bearest the tool that rends the hills.
text.1: thou rich in torrents who with might quickenest earth o mighty one.
text.2: to thee o wanderer at will ring out the lauds with beams of day.
text.3: who drivest like a neighing steed the swelling cloud o bright of hue.
text.4: who graspest with thy might on earth een the strong sovrans of the wood.
text.5: when from the lightning of thy cloud the rainfloods of the heaven descend.
